usefulItems: skillet or frying pan, paper towels, baking dish (9 in. x 13 in.), large bowl, oven
title: Ancho-Cranberry Turkey Enchiladas

ingredients.content: 3 dried ancho chilies, de-stemmed and de-seeded
1 dried 'chile de árbol' chili, de-stemmed and de-seeded (optional)
1 can black beans (approx. 15 oz), rinsed, drained

preparations.content: Place ancho and 'chile de árbol' chilies into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>.

Add onions, garlic and oil and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and sauté <b>5 min/212°F/speed 0.5<b>.

Add stock, cranberry sauce, tomato paste, oregano, cumin and salt, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook <b>20 min/212°F/speed 2<b>. Insert measuring cup and blend <b>1 min/speed 3<b>-8<b>, increasing speed gradually. Transfer Ancho-Cranberry Sauce into a bowl and set aside. Preheat oven to 350°F. Clean mixing bowl.
Place Monterey Jack cheese and cheddar cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place cooked turkey into mixing bowl and shred <b>5 sec//speed 4<b>. Transfer to a large bowl, add half the reserved grated cheese and black beans, mix well with spatula to combine and set aside.

Heat a skillet over medium heat and add oil as needed. Lightly fry corn tortillas (approx. 20-30 sec. per side). Drain on paper towels and dip into reserved Ancho-Cranberry Sauce to fully coat. Set aside.

Divide shredded turkey mixture between reserved corn tortillas and roll up. Place seam-side down in a baking dish (9 in. x 13 in.). Top with Ancho-Cranberry Sauce, to taste and remaining grated cheese. Bake for 20 minutes (350°F).
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro to serve.

hintsAndTricks: Replace cooked turkey meat with store-bought rotisserie chicken.
